nodes.text: Battlecruiser 19 was the callsign of a Munificent-class star frigate that served within the naval forces of the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. In 21 BBY, during the Battle of Ryloth, Battlecruiser 19 served as a frigate in the Confederacy's blockade of the planet Ryloth. During the battle, the frigate was ordered into the Ryloth system as part of the blockade's commander, Neimoidian Captain Mar Tuuk's trap set for the Galactic Republic's fleet of Jedi General Anakin Skywalker, which forced them out of the system.

Sometime later, the Republic returned to the system, where they sent a starfighter squadron commanded by Skywalker's Padawan, Ahsoka Tano, to attack the blockade. As a result, the blockade, all Munificent frigates, including Battlecruiser 19, were destroyed by Tano's squadron.

A 825-meter long, 426-meter wide, 243-meter tall Munificent-class star frigate, Battlecruiser 19 was equipped with seven ion drive thrusters, a hyperdrive generator and two long-range hyperwave transceiver masts. Mounted at the vessel's prow were two heavy turbolaser cannons and two long-range heavy ion cannons, and was additionally armed with thirty-four light turbolaser cannons (seventeen port, seventeen starboard). On either side of its hull, the frigate featured the emblem of the Confederacy of Independent Systems.
Battlecruiser 19 was introduced in "Storm Over Ryloth," the nineteenth episode of the animated television series Star Wars: The Clone Wars' first season, which originally aired on February 27, 2009.
